qas.question: What is the point of using different colors on a heat map?

answers.text: indicating the level of resource usage

qas.question: What changes were made to the BSoD?

answers.text: a simpler and modern design with less technical information displayed

qas.question: What are some of the process type groups Windows 8 implemented?

answers.text: applications, background processes and Windows processes

qas.question: How can users find out more about obscure Windows 8 processes?

plausible_answers.text: indicating the level of resource usage

plausible_answers.text: indicating the level of resource usage

plausible_answers.text: a simpler and modern design with less technical information displayed

plausible_answers.text: applications, background processes and Windows processes

qas.question: What are some of the process type groups Windows 9 implemented?
How can users find out more about obscure Windows 9 processes?

context: Task Manager has been redesigned, including a new processes tab with the option to display fewer or more details of running applications and background processes, a heat map using different colors <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>indicating the level of resource usage<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, network and disk counters, grouping by process type (e.g. <a2_0><b7_0>applications, background processes and Windows processes<b7_0/><a2_0/>), friendly names for processes and a new option which allows users to <a3_0><b8_0>search the web<b8_0/><a3_0/> to find information about obscure processes. Additionally, the Blue Screen of Death has been updated with <a1_0><b6_0>a simpler and modern design with less technical information displayed<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
